page.title: 11ADLINGTON HALL ESTATE
page.content: The estate contains about two thousand acres. Most of it is let to tenant farmers for grazing of stock, especially cows and sheep. The grounds are used each week by an archery club, and other societies hold functions at the hall or in its grounds. The North West Motor Show is held here each year. The number of visitors to the hall is declining. In 1978 eleven thousand were recorded, but these have now fallen to five thousand. Overseas visitors also come. The stables were converted two years ago and are used for wedding parties and receptions. There are no plans to develop the hall as a pleasure park as others have done. Handel, the famous composer stayed at the hall and wrote music for a hunting song during his visit.
